description: Package selection involves choosing the right software packages or libraries that best meet the requirements of a project. This can be challenging due to the vast number of available options and the need for relevant, high-quality recommendations.
you_have_this_if: You are overwhelmed by the number of available packages.
You receive irrelevant results from traditional search engines.
You need to recommend packages based on specific developer queries.
You want to improve the explainability of your package recommendations.
You are facing difficulties in evaluating the quality of packages.

approaches.best_for: When you need to recommend JavaScript packages based on developer queries and improve explainability.
approaches.key_tradeoff: While RAG improves relevance and explainability, it may require more resources than traditional methods.

decision_matrix.best_when: You need accurate package recommendations and are dealing with complex queries.

start_here: Start with Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) as it provides a balance of accuracy and explainability for package recommendations.
related_problems: Search Engine Optimization for Software Packages
